page.name: requirements
page.summary: Sparx in general and XAF in particular is completely application server and platform neutral. All of the XAF's many features are available in any Java 2- compliant application server like WebLogic, Websphere, Tomcat, and Resin. No special services like EJBs are required but the XAF works very well as a J2EE application framework.

ul.li: Language - Java Development Kit (JDK) 1.2 or above.
Platforms - Any platform that supports JDK 1.2 or above (e.g. NT, Windows 2000, Unix, Linux, Mac).
Databases - Any relational or object database that has a JDBC 2.0 driver (e.g. Oracle, Sybase, SQL Server).
Application Server - Any application server that supports the Java Servlet 2.2 or above specification (Weblogic, Websphere, Resin, Tomcat, etc).
Web Development - Servlets, Java Server Pages (JSP), Taglibs, XML (using JAXP), XSLT.
Object Services Protocols - Can utilize CORBA, EJB, RMI, SOAP, DCOM or other object services.
Process Models - Supports a variety of process models like waterfall, RAD, JAD, XP (Extreme Programming), and other lightweight development processes.
MVC - Uses the Model View Controller (MVC) design pattern to separate business logic, presentation, and data storage.

page.section:
Sparx requires all of the following libraries and components as prerequisites
Java2 JDK
Application Server (Weblogic, Websphere, Tomcat, Resin, etc) supporting Servlet 2.2 or above and JDBC 2.0 or above APIs
Jakarta Ant 1.4.1 or above
Jakarta Log4J 1.1 or above
Jakarta ORO 2.0 or above
Apache Xerces 1.4 or above
Apache Xalan 2.1 or above
